category.description: Category of the perfume (e.g., testers, travel size).

sizeMl.description: Size of the perfume bottle in milliliters.

discountPercentage.description: The discount percentage applied to the product (e.g., 0.2 for 20% off).

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Aromance website.

rewardPoints.description: Reward points accumulated by the user.

wholesale.description: Flag indicating if the user has wholesale account.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a customer review for a product.

rating.description: Rating given by the user (e.g., 1 to 5 stars).

comment.description: Text comment provided by the user.

orderDate.description: Date when the order was placed.

status.description: Status of the order (e.g., processing, shipped, delivered).

shippingAddress.description: The address the order was shipped to.

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents an item within an order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order item.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product in the order item.

itemPrice.description: Price of the item at the time of the order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the reward program.

pointsPerDollar.description: Number of reward points earned per dollar spent.

redemptionRate.description: The amount that one reward point is worth in dollars.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to optimize for security, scalability, and query performance, particularly for an e-commerce application like Aromance.  The structure adheres to Authorization Independence by avoiding hierarchical `get()` calls in security rules.  It utilizes structural segregation for homogenous security postures and adopts consistent access modeling patterns.

Products are stored in a top-level collection (`/products`) with a predictable schema. Reviews are stored in a subcollection under each product (`/products/{productId}/reviews`), including the userId denormalized within each review document to enforce consistent data integrity and enabling performant queries to retrieve a user's reviews for a specific product.

Users are stored in a top-level collection (`/users`), Orders are stored in a subcollection under each user (`/users/{userId}/orders`), and OrderItems are stored in a subcollection under each order (`/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}/orderItems`). This structure ensures that orders and order items are directly associated with their respective users, making it easy to retrieve and manage user-specific data.  The `userId` is also added as a denormalized field to orders to ensure authorization independence. 

RewardProgram information is stored in a singleton document at `/reward_program/config`, which simplifies access to global reward program configurations.

This structure supports required QAPs by:

*   Segregating data with different access needs into separate collections (e.g., products, users).
*   Using path-based ownership for user-related data (`/users/{userId}/orders`) simplifies security rules and enables efficient list operations.
*   The Membership Map pattern would be applicable if collaborative features were added in the future, for example, sharing draft orders between multiple users.
